content.description: A soft rock corner leads to a big undercling to the left, then go straight up the steep face. The upper face is pretty fun, but the rock down low is quite sugary.
content.protection: I think this one is 8 or 9 bolts. A few long draws are nice for the bottom.

content.description: This route follows the obvious crack on the left side of the wall. Stepping left around the crux bulge is easier than staying in the crack, but not as well protected.
content.protection: Single set of cams from BD .3 - 3.
content.location: Crack on the left side of the Stage.

content.description: Bolted face just right of the crack.
content.location: Just right of Super Rad Trad.

content.description: Start up a fractured pillar leading to a steep right-leaning crack to an a-frame slot at the bulge. Follow an easier crack to the anchor.
content.protection: 4 bolts and a .75 and/or 1 camalot for the top. A couple of long draws are nice.
content.location: Look for the right-leaning, right-facing crack and a-frame slot near the middle of the wall.

content.description: A fun stemming move off the big boulder leads to an easier face climb
content.location: Begins off the boulder between "Muppets are Puppets Too" and "Dirty Harry"

content.description: The first bolted route at The Stage. It climbs the short arete behind the boulder.
content.location: Left-most route at the wall. Starts just left of the large boulder.

content.description: Climb the blunt prow with dark rock in the middle of the wall. Low crux.
content.location: About 10 feet right of Rowlf's Waltz.

content.description: This route is short but steep, and a fun warm up on your way over to the harder stuff at the theater. Step off the big boulder and follow edges and huecos up and left. Probably best to have your belayer standing down below to prevent the awkward swing off the block should you take the whip. This route is new and is likely to produce some surprise ejecta. Helmets advised.
content.location: Route starts in the small alcove left of the large leaning block that is the start of "Opening Act"

content.description: A steep start on somewhat soft rock leads to a lower angle section with more widely spaced bolts and then up the nice black face with eyebrow features.
content.location: Just right of the big boulder at the base of the wall. The upper face faces more west/northwest than the rest of the cliff.

content.description: Climbs a short vertical face on the left side of the Stage wall
content.location: Just right of the boulder on the left side of the wall. Has a high first bolt that is hard to see. Crux is off the ground so don't blow it before you make the clip.

content.description: Face climb with two low bolts close to each other. Similar to its neighbor Soliloquy.
